abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column maintains that, in light of repeated doping scandals in international track and field, it is hard for sports fans to believe in athletes, especially those who have been caught doping more than once; speculates on factors that might contribute to recidivism.
lead_paragraph: The track and field world championships concluded with a host of questions about the performances fans had witnessed, as doping accusations swirled around performers from Kenya, Russia and elsewhere.

headline.main: What’s Real in Track? It’s Hard to Know
headline.print_headline: What’s Real in Track? It’s Hard to Know

snippet: The track and field world championships concluded with a host of questions about the performances fans had witnessed, as doping accusations swirled around performers from Kenya, Russia and elsewhere.
